onboarding.dx_experiment_1.choose_produc: Welcome to Cloudflare, what's your goal?
Accelerate and protect your website or application.
Improve the security and performance of anything connected to the Internet.
Make getting work done on the Internet faster and safer for distributed teams.
Build and scale without maintaining infrastructure.
Deploy websites and applications to Region: Earth with performance, security, and reliability built in.

onboarding.teams.access.title: Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA)
onboarding.teams.access.description: Connect any user to any application and private network faster and more securely than a VPN by enforcing identity and context- based rules and limiting lateral movement.
onboarding.teams.gateway.title: Secure Web Gateway (SWG)
onboarding.teams.gateway.description: Block known and unknown Internet threats u2014 and easily control data flows u2014 by enforcing DNS, HTTP, network, and browser isolation rules with unlimited SSL inspection.
onboarding.teams.remote_browser.title: Remote Browser Isolation (RBI)
onboarding.teams.remote_browser.descript: Execute web code in the cloud, not on devices, for unrivaled threat and data protection controls. No pixel pushing or code scrubbing, so it feels like a regular browser.
onboarding.teams.platform.title: Built-From-Scratch Platform
onboarding.teams.platform.description: One unified control plane with single-pane management and single-pass inspection for ZTNA, SWG and RBI that can also replace your VPN, DNS filter and CASB point products.

Automatic renewals may be cancelled at any time via the Billing page in your account.  Automatic renewals will be billed to the payment method on file, until cancelled.

onboarding.add_records_method.descriptio: Cloudflare needs DNS records to speed up and protect your site
onboarding.add_records_method.quick_scan:
Scan for common hostnames and record types
Intended for personal or small websites

onboarding.add_records_method.dns_file_u:
Add records with a DNS file from your current provider
Intended for websites with a large number of records
onboarding.quick_scan.title: Quick scan
onboarding.quick_scan.description: We are scanning your site for DNS records to import automatically into your Cloudflare configuration.
onboarding.quick_scan.status.failed: We were unable to complete the scan
onboarding.quick_scan.status.failed.acti: <0>Scan again</0> or <1>change your DNS setup method</1>.
onboarding.dns_file_upload.title: DNS file upload
onboarding.dns_file_upload.description: Add records by uploading a DNS file in <0>BIND format</0>.
onboarding.dns_file_upload.status.failed: We were unable to successfully import your domain's DNS records.
onboarding.dns_file_upload.failed.action: Select another file or <0>change your DNS setup method</0>.
onboarding.secondary_dns.confirm_seconda: Verify that the DNS records below are correct. Cloudflare serves these records after you update your nameservers.
Check that you have configured your primary DNS correctly. If your primary DNS provider does not support DNS NOTIFY, click "initiate zone transfer".
onboarding.secondary_dns.dns_masters.des: You may add more than one primary DNS server

A primary DNS server is an external DNS server where you manage your DNS records.
Transfer records from to Cloudflare's Secondary DNS with a zone transfer.
onboarding.manual_entry.title: Manual entry
Without DNS records, Cloudflare is unable to activate your site. It's best if you set up your DNS records now.
onboarding.confirm_records.title: Review your DNS records
onboarding.confirm_records.quick_scan: We automatically detected **%{smart_count} DNS** record on your site that matches common hostnames and record types. |||| We automatically detected **%{smart_count} DNS** records on your site that match common hostnames and record types.
onboarding.confirm_records.dns_file_uplo: **%{smart_count} DNS record was added** |||| **%{smart_count} DNS records were added**
onboarding.confirm_records.manual_entry: Cloudflare needs DNS records to protect and accelerate your site. If you have an existing DNS provider, we recommend adding DNS records using the <0>Quick Scan</0>.
onboarding.confirm_records.summary.title: Records we found:
onboarding.confirm_records.description: Verify that DNS records below are configured correctly. These records take effect in Cloudflare after you update your nameservers.
onboarding.confirm_records.warning: Our scan may have missed uncommon records or custom subdomains. Compare the list below to your current DNS provider (most likely your registrar) and add any missing records. Pay close attention to all records on the zone apex, records of the type A, AAAA, and CNAME and records needed for email like MX, SPF, DMARC, DKIM, and MTA-STS.
onboarding.confirm_records.proxied.http_: **Proxied:** HTTP traffic goes through the Cloudflare network. Required for services like caching, smart routing, and Web Application Firewall.
onboarding.confirm_records.dns_only.http: **DNS only:** HTTP traffic bypasses Cloudflare and goes directly to the origin, but DNS resolution still benefits from our fast and secure network. A gray cloud means proxying is off, no cloud means the record is not eligible for proxying.
onboarding.confirm_records.table.note: **Note:** Records with no cloud icon use DNS resolution but cannot be proxied.
onboarding.confirm_records.table.title: Add more DNS records for %{zoneName}
onboarding.confirm_records.table.proxy_t: Your traffic is almost ready to proxy
onboarding.confirm_records.table.descrip: Proxy traffic for A, AAAA, and CNAME records by clicking the toggle next to the cloud icon.
onboarding.confirm_records.table.proxy_d: Your DNS records tell Cloudflare where your web content is hosted, so we can hide the origin and proxy your web traffic.
onboarding.nameserver_directions.title: Change your nameservers
onboarding.nameserver_directions.warning: Pointing to Cloudflareu2019s nameservers is critical for activating your site successfully. Otherwise, Cloudflare is unable to manage your DNS and optimize your site.
Pointing to Cloudflareu2019s nameservers is a critical step in activation and must be complete for Cloudflare to optimize and protect your site.
Adding Cloudflare's secondary nameservers is critical for activating your site successfully. Otherwise, Cloudflare is unable to manage your DNS and optimize your site.
onboarding.nameserver_directions.step_on: 1. Log in to your registrar account
Log in to the domain registrar or reseller where you registered the parent domain
Log in to the domain registrar or reseller where you registered the parent domain
onboarding.nameserver_directions.heading: Last step: Update your nameservers to activate Cloudflare
onboarding.nameserver_directions.descrip: This is the last step to allow Cloudflare to speed up and protect your web traffic. This is unlikely to cause downtime, but you may skip this and check your <0>DNS records</0> first.
onboarding.nameserver_directions.step_on: Log into your DNS provider (most likely your registrar)
If you purchased your domain through a reseller (e.g., Squarespace) or use a separate DNS provider, log into that account instead.
onboarding.nameserver_directions.step_tw: Find and turn off the DNS security (DNSSEC) setting if it is on. You can re-enable it later through Cloudflare.
onboarding.nameserver_directions.step_th: Replace your current nameservers with Cloudflare nameservers
Add both of your assigned Cloudflare nameservers:
onboarding.nameserver_directions.login_t: <0>Log in</0> to the <1>administrator account</1> for your domain registrar
onboarding.nameserver_directions.seconda: 2. Add Cloudflareu2019s Secondary Nameservers in addition to the existing nameservers at your registrar:
onboarding.nameserver_directions.add_sec: <0>Add</0> Cloudflareu2019s Secondary Nameservers in addition to the existing nameservers at your registrar
onboarding.nameserver_directions.save_ch: Check to make sure they're correct, then **save your changes.**
onboarding.nameserver_directions.update_: Registrars can take 24 hours to process nameserver updates. You will receive an email when your site is active on Cloudflare.
onboarding.nameserver_directions.help: Learn how to <0>change nameservers in Cloudflare</0>.
onboarding.nameserver_directions.info: <0>Nameservers</0> are your primary <1>DNS</1> controller and identify the location of your domain on the internet.
onboarding.activation_methods.title: Select a method for moving %{domain} to Cloudflare
onboarding.activation_methods.method_reg: It looks like your domain registration changed in the last 60 days, which prevents us from starting a transfer.
Setup Cloudflare by transferring your domain to Cloudflare Registrar, the world's first at-cost registrar.
onboarding.activation_methods.method_nam: Setup Cloudflare by changing your nameservers. This is the default method for adding a site.
onboarding.recommendations_hub.title: Do More With Cloudflare
onboarding.recommendations_hub.descripti: Not sure where to start? Review our recommendations to better protect and optimize your website.
Configure your website settings to improve security, optimize performance, and get the most from your plan.
onboarding.recommendations_hub.config_re: Select from recommendations tailored to your website to improve security and performance.
onboarding.recommendations.config.title: Configuration recommendations
onboarding.recommendations.config.descri: Select from recommendations tailored to your website to improve security and performance. All changes take effect immediately.
onboarding.recommendations.config.always: Redirect all requests with scheme u201Chttpu201D to u201Chttpsu201D. This applies to all http requests to the zone.
onboarding.recommendations.config.automa: Automatic HTTPS Rewrites helps fix mixed content by changing u201Chttpu201D to u201Chttpsu201D for all resources or links on your web site that can be served with HTTPS.
onboarding.recommendations.config.brotli: Speeds up page load times for your visitoru2019s HTTPS traffic.
onboarding.recommendations.config.polish: Improve image load time by optimizing images hosted on your domain. Optionally, the WebP image codec can be used with supported clients for additional performance benefits.
onboarding.recommendations.config.mirage: Improve load time for pages that include images on mobile devices with slow network connections.
onboarding.recommendations.exit: To exit, <0>go to the overview page</0>.
onboarding.recommendations.title: Quick Start Guide
onboarding.recommendations.description: Configure your domain settings to improve security, optimize performance, and get the most from your account.
onboarding.recommendations.description.f: Configure your domain settings to improve security and get the most from your account.
onboarding.recommendations.activation.ch: Registrars can take 24 hours to process nameserver updates. You will receive an email when your site is active on Cloudflare.
onboarding.recommendations.security.http: Redirecting all u201Chttpu201D requests to u201Chttpsu201D prevents attackers from tampering with communication between your servers and your users' browsers.
<0>SSL</0> must be enabled in order to use this feature.
onboarding.recommendations.security.rewr: Loading data to your site via HTTPS protects your site from eavesdropping and tampering. This feature will rewrite URLs from u201Chttpu201D to u201Chttpsu201D for all domains that support HTTPS, improving your siteu2019s security.
onboarding.recommendations.security.mana: The Web Application Firewall protects your application by analyzing characteristics from each request and determining how the request should be completed.
onboarding.recommendations.performance.p: To optimize your site, the recommended configuration is Lossless selected and WebP checked.
onboarding.recommendations.summary.title: Summary
onboarding.recommendations.card.toggle.m: To better protect your site, the reccommended configuration is ON.
onboarding.recommendations.card.checkbox: To optimize your site, the recommended configuration is enabled for all types.
onboarding.recommendations.speed.card.ti: Speed up your website or application
onboarding.recommendations.speed.card.de: Turn on recommended image, content, and protocol settings.
onboarding.signup.content_panel.product_: Protect and accelerate anything connected to the Internet.
Secure your websites, APIs, and Internet applications
Protect corporate networks, employees, and devices
Write and deploy code that runs on the network edge
Powered by a global network that gets smarter with every request
onboarding.signup.next_steps.title: What happens next?
onboarding.signup.next_steps.onboard_dom: Enter your domain name and choose a free or paid plan.
Make a quick change to your domain's DNS settings.
onboarding.signup.next_steps.congratulat: Congratulations! Your traffic is running through Cloudflare.
Leave it to us to customize how your traffic is processed.
onboarding.stepper.back.title: Go back to %{location}?
onboarding.stepper.modal.description: By exiting this form, you will lose your current progress.
onboarding.stepper.modal.cancel: Take me back to the form
onboarding.zone.stepper.page_description: Optimize security, performance, and reliability of your web traffic.
onboarding.zone.stepper.enter_domain.des: This process sets up your web traffic to <1>proxy through Cloudflare</1>. Proxying speeds up and protects websites and services served by this domain.
onboarding.zone.stepper.enter_domain.con: Cloudflare will become the primary <1>DNS provider</1> for this <3>domain</3>, meaning your <5>DNS records</5> are managed at Cloudflare, and we authoritatively answer all DNS queries.
onboarding.zone.stepper.select_plan.desc: Continue with a Free plan or upgrade for additional services.
onboarding.zone.stepper.select_plan.cont: Contact Cloudflare to purchase an Enterprise plan
onboarding.zone.stepper.select_plan.whic: Which plan is right for you?
onboarding.zone.stepper.modal.descriptio: You will lose your progress if you leave now.
onboarding.zone.stepper.activation.modal: Your domain will not activate on Cloudflare until you change your nameservers.
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.title: Add DNS records for %{zoneName}
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.description: Your <1>DNS records</1> tell Cloudflare where your web content is hosted.
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.finding.desc: Please do not refresh the page.
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.content: Our <1>quick scan</1> checks for common hostnames and DNS record types, and adds them to Cloudflare for you. You will have a chance to add other records/subdomains before activating your domain.
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.added.title: DNS records added for %{zoneName}
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.added.record: We found %{recordNumber} DNS records of the following <1>types</1>
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.added.conten: These records tell Cloudflare where your web content is hosted, so we can sit in front of the origin server and <1>proxy your web traffic</1>.

By default, Cloudflare proxies traffic for A, AAAA, and CNAME records. Other records <1>are not proxied</1>, but their DNS resolution still benefits from the security and performance of the Cloudflare network.
Next, we will walk you through changing the <1>nameservers</1> for your domain.
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.quick_scan.d: Checks for common hostnames and DNS record types, and adds them to Cloudflare for you. You will have a chance to add other records/subdomains before activating your domain.
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.quick_scan.l: Learn more about DNS quick scan
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.manual_entry: Upload a BIND file from your current DNS provider, or add records manually. You will be taken to another page to add your records, then follow the prompt to activate your domain.
Learn more about importing DNS records
You will be taken to the DNS records page. You then must follow the prompt on that page to finish activating your domain.
onboarding.zone.stepper.dns.confirm_reco: The <1>records quick scan</1> might not find custom subdomains and uncommon record types. You should <3>review your list of DNS records</3> before activation.
No DNS records found for %{zoneName}. <1>Add DNS records manually.</1>
onboarding.zone.stepper.activation.title: Start domain activation
onboarding.zone.stepper.review.title: %{domain} is pending activation
onboarding.zone.stepper.review.notificat: Registrars take up to 24 hours to process nameserver changes (quicker in most cases). We will email you when example.com is active on Cloudflare.
onboarding.zone.stepper.review.content.n: Next, we will show you where you can update your configuration and monitor performance.

zero_trust.path_picker.heading: Cloudflare Zero Trust
zero_trust.path_picker.subheading: Replace legacy security perimeters with Cloudflareu2019s global edge, making the Internet faster and safer for both teams and home networks.

zero_trust.pick_task.subheading: Weu2019ll quickly guide you through set-up and how to get started.
